Post.title: Statistic
Post._content:
### Beyes

$$P(H|D) = \frac{P(H) \cdot P(D|H)}{P(D)}$$

H: hyposis D: data 

- $P(H|D)$ : , the probability of observing event H given that D is true
- $P(H)$ : , the probability of observing event H
- $P(D|H)$: 
- $P(D)$ :   the probability of data D

:
  $P(H)$ : 
  $P(D)$ : 
  $P(D|H)$ : 
  $P(H|D)$ :

Post.title: entropy
Post._content:
### 



$log\frac{1}{p}$



$\log_2m$   -  
 7000  13  13 13bit  10%  95%  8-9  5 250   320KB  1MB redundancy)  250 

### Entropy

($\log\frac{1}{p}$)

 shannon

$$\begin{align} H(X) & = E[I(X)] \\ & = E[-ln(P(X))]  \\ & = -\sum\limits_{i}^n P(x_i)logP(x_i)\end{align} $$





, bit sh(annon) (2)nat()Hart10

- 

$H(X)=log_2{m}$



$2^3=8$

$log_2{8}=2\ bit$

- 

$H(X)=\sum\limits_{i}^nP(x_i)log\frac{1}{P(x_i)}$

ABCD

$H(X)=\sum\limits_{i}^n\frac{1}{4}log_2(\frac{1}{4})=2 bit$

A$H(X)=\sum\limits_{i}^n\frac{1}{3}log_2(\frac{1}{3})=1.585 bit$

A$2-1.585=0.415bit$



p=(1/2, 1/2, 0, 0)AB1/2CD0H(p)11AB

q=(1/4, 1/4, 1/4, 1/4)H(q)=22ABCD

### [](https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BA%A4%E5%8F%89%E7%86%B5)

 q  p 

$H(p,q)= E_p[\log  \frac{1}{q(i)}] = \sum\limits_{i}^{} p(i)*log\frac{1}{q(i)} $

 q  p

2pqpq

p()$H(p)=\sum\limits_{i}^{} p(i)*log\frac{1}{p(i)}$

qp$H(p,q)=\sum\limits_{i}^{} p(i)*log\frac{1}{q(i)} $

qpH(p,q)p(i)H(p,q)

4(A,B,C,D)p=(1/2, 1/2, 0, 0)AB1/2CD0H(p)11ABQ=(1/4, 1/4, 1/4, 1/4)H(p,q)=22AB(CD)

qH(p,q)pH(p)[Gibbs' inequality](https://link.zhihu.com/?target=https%3A//en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gibbs%2527_inequality)H(p,q)>=H(p)qp

### KL

 p  q  q  p

$D_{KL}(p||q)=H(p,q)-H(p) = \sum\limits_{i}^{} p(i)*\log\frac{1}{q(i)} - \sum\limits_{i}^{} p(i) *\log\frac{1}{p(i)} = \sum\limits_{i}^{} p(i)*\log\frac{p(i)}{q(i)}$

qpbitKL(KullbackLeibler divergenceKLD) [KullbackLeibler divergence](https://link.zhihu.com/?target=https%3A//en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kullback%25E2%2580%2593Leibler_divergence)20

 $H(p,q)= E_p[\log  \frac{1}{q(i)}] = H(p) + D_{KL}(p||q)$

 $H(p)$  $p$ [](https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BF%A1%E6%81%AF%E7%86%B5)$D_{KL}(p\|q)$  $p$  $q$ [KL](https://zh.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=KL%E6%95%A3%E5%BA%A6&action=edit&redlink=1)(*p**q***)

pD(p||q)H(p,q)2

### 

()pqpq



1. 
2.  sigmod  sigmod0() sigmod  sigmod 

```python
# softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits
cross_entropy_lst = tf.nn.softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits(logits=logits, labels=y_)
# reduce_sumbatch
cross_entropy = tf.reduce_sum(tf.nn.softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits(logits=logits, labels=y_))
# batch
cross_entropy_loss = tf.reduce_mean(tf.nn.softmax_cross_entropy_with_logits(logits=logits, labels=y_))

>>>
[ 0.40760595  0.40760595  0.40760595]
1.22282
0.407606
```

## 1. Neuron Network Unit

NeuronDendritesaxon

$x_0,x_1,...,x_n$$w_0x_0,w_1x_1,...,w_nx_n$$w$$f(\sum_{i}w_ix_i+b)$

## 2. 

|         |                                     |           |  |  |
| ------- | --------------------------------------- | ------------- | ---- | ---- |
| sigmoid | $ \sigma(x)=\frac{1}{1+e^{-x}} $        | [0,1]         | [0, 0.25]   |  |
| tanh    | $tanh(x)=\frac{e^x-e^{-x}}{e^x+e^{-x}}$ | [-1,1]        | [0, 1]     |      |
| relu    | $relu(x)=max(0, x)$                     | $[0,+\infty]$ |$f'_x=\begin{cases}0, x<0\\1, x>0\\undefinded, x=0\end{cases}$||

#### Leaky Relu

Relu

$$f(x)=\begin{cases}x, x>0\\\alpha x, x<0\end{cases}$$, $\alpha=0.01$

#### ELU

$$f(x)=\begin{cases} x, x>0\\ \alpha(e^x-1), x\leq0\end{cases}$$

![1560776449074](nn_cs231n_note/1560776449074.png)

#### Maxout

$$max(w_{1}^Tx+b_1, w_{2}^Tx+b_2)$$

X = X / np.std(X, axis=1)

```

```

#### He Normal

$\frac{2}{n}$

ReLU**w = np.random.randn(n) \* sqrt(2.0/n)**

```python
W = np.random.randn(n) * sqrt(2.0/n)
```

####  biases

```
b = np.zeros(n,)
```

## Dropout

![img](nn_cs231n_note/63fcf4cc655cb04f21a37e86aca333cf_hd.png)

1.  Bagging 
2. 
3. 

```
"""
: .
drop.
"""

p = 0.5 # . p = 

def train_step(X):
  # 3neural network
  H1 = np.maximum(0, np.dot(W1, X) + b1)
  #                  [0, 1] P(rand(x)) < p = p
  mask1 = (np.random.rand(*H1.shape) < p) / p # . /p!
  H1 *= mask1 # drop!
  H2 = np.maximum(0, np.dot(W2, H1) + b2)
  mask2 = (np.random.rand(*H2.shape) < p) / p # . /p!
  H2 *= mask2 # drop!
  out = np.dot(W3, H2) + b3

  # :... ()
  # ... ()

def predict(X):
  # 
  H1 = np.maximum(0, np.dot(W1, X) + b1) # 
  H2 = np.maximum(0, np.dot(W2, H1) + b2)
  out = np.dot(W3, H2) + b3
```

## Dropout

![img](nn_cs231n_note/63fcf4cc655cb04f21a37e86aca333cf_hd.png)

1.  Bagging 
2. 
3. 

```
"""
: .
drop.
"""

p = 0.5 # . p = 

def train_step(X):
  # 3neural network
  H1 = np.maximum(0, np.dot(W1, X) + b1)
  #                  [0, 1] P(rand(x)) < p = p
  mask1 = (np.random.rand(*H1.shape) < p) / p # . /p!
  H1 *= mask1 # drop!
  H2 = np.maximum(0, np.dot(W2, H1) + b2)
  mask2 = (np.random.rand(*H2.shape) < p) / p # . /p!
  H2 *= mask2 # drop!
  out = np.dot(W3, H2) + b3

  # :... ()
  # ... ()

def predict(X):
  # 
  H1 = np.maximum(0, np.dot(W1, X) + b1) # 
  H2 = np.maximum(0, np.dot(W2, H1) + b2)
  out = np.dot(W3, H2) + b3
```
